solution.text:
The concerned chemical reactions are

(i) $\underset{64 \mathrm{~kg}}{\mathrm{CaC}_{2}+2 \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O} \rightarrow \mathrm{Ca}(\mathrm{OH})_{2}}+\underset{\text { Ethyne, } 26 \mathrm{~kg}}{\mathrm{C}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{2}}$

(ii) $\mathrm{C}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{2}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \rightarrow \underset{\text { Ethylene }, 28 \mathrm{~kg}}{\mathrm{C}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{4}}$

$$

\text { (iii) } \mathrm{nC}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{2} \rightarrow\left[-\mathrm{CH}_{2}-\mathrm{CH}_{2}-\right]_{\mathrm{n}}

$$

$\begin{array}{ll}\mathrm{n} \times 28 \mathrm{~kg} & \mathrm{n} \times 28 \mathrm{~kg} \text { polythene } \\ \text { or } 28 \mathrm{~kg} & \text { or } 28 \mathrm{~kg}\end{array}$

Thus $64 \mathrm{~kg}$ of $\mathrm{CaC}_{2}$ gives $26 \mathrm{~kg}$ of acetylene which in turn gives $28 \mathrm{~kg}$ of ethylene whose $28 \mathrm{~kg}$ gives $28 \mathrm{~kg}$ of the polymer, polythene.
